method.name: Minimal Consistent Set

reference.ref: B. V. Dasarathy. Minimal Consistent Set (MCS) Identification for Optimal Nearest Neighbor Decision Systems Design. IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man and Cybernetics 24:3 (1994) 511-517.

generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Reduction. Instance Selection. Incremental.
generalDescription.objective: Reduce the size of the training set without losing precision or accuracy in order to a posterior classification
generalDescription.howWork: MCS selection is based on the concept of NUNS, the Nearest Unlike Neighbor Subset, which can be looked upon as an optimal descriptor of the inter-class boundaries. The NUN subset is defined as the unique set of all samples which are the nearest unlike neighbors of one or more of the given samples.

parameterSpec.param: Distance Function: K-NN implements two distance functions. a) Euclidean with normalized attributed and b) HVDM (see paper D.R. Wilson, T.R. Martinez. Reduction Tecniques For Instance-Based Learning Algorithms. Machine Learning 38:3 (2000) 257-286.)
